body:
About `grad(abs(0)) = 0`, well, it is not differentiable in `x=0`, and it's sub-derivative can be anything between -1 and 1.
I had a quick look at what TF does, and I have the impression that the gradient at 0 is defined in the same way as in PyTorch, compare [TF abs](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/ops/math_grad.py#L245) and [PyTorch abs](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/autograd/_functions/pointwise.py#L139), and the underlying `sign` function has the same derivative, [TF sign](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/ops/math_grad.py#L596) and [PyTorch sign](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/autograd/_functions/pointwise.py#L363)
